Sells for: $1\nMax Consumeables: 2\nOwned Tags: None\nOwned Vouchers:\n1: Director's Cut - Reroll Boss Blind 1 time per Ante, $10 per roll\n2: Tarot Merchant - Tarot cards appear 2X more frequently in the shop\n3: Grabber - Permanently gain +1 hand per round\n4: Hieroglyph - -1 Ante, -1 hand each round\nCurrent Money: $30\n## Pack Choices\nBooster Pack Choices:\n1: Name: The World. Description: Converts up to 3 selected cards to Spades\n2: Name: The High Priestess. Description: Creates up to 2 random Planet cards (Must have room)\n3: Name: The Sun. Description: Converts up to 3 selected cards to Hearts\nHand:\n1: Name: Ace of Spades. Description: +11 chips\n2: Name: 10 of Spades. Description: +10 chips\n3: Name: 3 of Hearts. Description: +3 chips\n4: Name: Ace of Clubs. Description: +11 chips X1.5 Mult while this card stays in hand. Enhancement: Steel Card\n5: Name: Ace of Clubs. Description: +11 chips. Secondary Description: Creates a Tarot card when discarded (Must have room)\n6: Name: Jack of Clubs. Description: +10 chips\n7: Name: 4 of Clubs. Description: +4 chips\n8: Name: 2 of Clubs. Description: +2 chips $3 if this card is held in hand at end of round. Enhancement: Gold Card\n# Run Metadata\n## Hand Levels:\nFlush Five: Level 2, Base Chips 210, Base Mult 19, Times Played 0\nFlush House: Level 2, Base Chips 180, Base Mult 18, Times Played 0\nFive of a Kind: Level 2, Base Chips 155, Base Mult 15, Times Played 0\nStraight Flush: Level 2, Base Chips 140, Base Mult 12, Times Played 0\nFour of a Kind: Level 2, Base Chips 90, Base Mult 10, Times Played 0\nFull House: Level 6, Base Chips 165, Base Mult 14, Times Played 4\nFlush: Level 3, Base Chips 65, Base Mult 8, Times Played 2\nStraight: Level 3, Base Chips 90, Base Mult 10, Times Played 0\nThree of a Kind: Level 9, Base Chips 190, Base Mult 19, Times Played 2\nTwo Pair: Level 2, Base Chips 40, Base Mult 3, Times Played 9\nPair: Level 8, Base Chips 115, Base Mult 9, Times Played 4\nHigh Card: Level 3, Base Chips 25, Base Mult 3, Times Played 2\n## Last Played Hands (most recent first):\nTwo Pair - 36,366 chips (Ante: 7, Blind: Small Blind)\nPair - 56,414.4 chips (Ante: 6, Blind: Boss)\nTwo Pair - 30,651.6 chips (Ante: 6, Blind: Boss)\nHigh Card - 16,530 chips (Ante: 6, Blind: Big Blind)\nTwo Pair - 26,790 chips (Ante: 6, Blind: Big Blind)\nFlush - 23,328 chips (Ante: 5, Blind: Boss)\nTwo Pair - 17,305.2 chips (Ante: 5, Blind: Big Blind)\n\n# Available Commands\nThe possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.\nNote: all position arguments are 1-indexed.\n\nThe following commands are available in your current game state.\nuse_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.\nsell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.\nrearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.\nsell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.\nselect <pack_card_position> <hand_card_position1> <hand_card_position2> ... <hand_card_positionN> - Select a card from the booster pack. The hand card positions may be required depending on if the booster pack card selected needs targets. In 'Mega' booster packs that say 'choose 2 of N', make the selections one at a time. If you intend to select cards 1 and 3 for example, issue a 'select 1' command, then a 'select 2' command, because the 3rd card position will become the second position after selecting the first card.\nskip_booster - Skip the remaining selections in the current booster pack.\nrearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.\n\n#Task\nAnalyze the total game state and context above, and respond with the appropriate action to take next."}
reasoning:
**Analysis of the Shop Phase: Maximizing Constellation Joker**

Okay, so here's the situation. I'm in Ante 7/8, Round 17, and in a Tarot Pack shop, looking to squeeze every last point out of this run. I've got $30, a solid Joker setup with a Green Joker, Spare Trousers, Certificate, Luchador (Polychrome), Constellation, and a Blue Joker, plus The Lovers consumable. I also have a few vouchers, but right now, I'm laser-focused on the immediate play.

I need to get the most value out of Constellation, which increases its multiplier by x0.1 for every Planet card played. I'm eyeing the High Priestess Tarot card, which creates Planet cards. Currently, it's at x3.0. The obvious play is to use High Priestess, but here's the kicker: The High Priestess creates "up to 2" Planets. My single consumable slot is occupied by The Lovers.

If I select High Priestess *now*, I get *one* Planet card. Not ideal. If I use The Lovers *first* I free up a slot, and then I select High Priestess and get *two* Planet cards. Double the planets, double the Constellation boost. So, that's what I need to do: use the consumable *before* selecting the High Priestess. The command to use is `use_consumable`. I can use The Lovers to make one of my cards wild, and in doing so, free up a slot in my hand. Then I'll have two free slots. That's optimal for maximizing the Constellation.

I want to check what cards I should turn into a Wild Card, and the 10 of Spades (position 2), seems ideal. It's not enhanced and it's not a steel or gold card.

Okay, let's step back for a second and look at the specifics. The game's pretty clear on the mechanics. Constellation only cares about how many Planets are *played*, so two is better than one. I know I have 1/2 consumables, and the description of High Priestess says "Creates *up to* 2 random Planet cards (Must have room)". I need to use "The Lovers" *before* picking up the High Priestess.

So the correct command is: `use_consumable 1 2`.

Now, before committing, I'm checking that that this is available while inside the shop. The commands list confirms it: `use_consumable` is there. It's the only logical choice!

And I *need* to be sure: One more look: I have space. I have the Lovers at slot 1, and the current hand at 8 cards, which will allow me to have 2 planet cards. The High Priestess says "up to" two. If I select it now, I only get one planet.

And with that final check, it's clear: `use_consumable` on card 2. After that, I select the High Priestess in the next turn and get the planet cards.

So, in JSON, the command I need is:

```json
{
  "action": "use_consumable",
  "positions": [1, 2]
}
```

That's the play to maximize Constellation, simple as that.
